results.title: An Airman remembers: recollections by Sir Gordon Taylor

results.title: An Afternoon with Grigor Piatigorsky
results.brief_description: The life and art of one of this centuries greatest exponents of the cello. He performs the exquisite minuets 1 and 2 from the suite by Johann Sebastian Bach.

results.title: An Act of faith
results.creator_credit: John Read, Robin Whitworth and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: The story of the new Cathedral at Coventry. Beginning with the blitz that destroyed the medieval church, it moves through all the stages of rebuilding and visits the studios of the artists concerned. Features Graham Sutherland’s gigantic tapestry, Epstein’s St. Michael and the devil, some of the stained glass windows, and the figures engraved on the plate glass entrance.

results.title: Amy on the lips
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film “Amy” starring Jenny Agutter and Barry Newman. Shows the attempts by one woman to teach deaf children to speak at the turn of this century. Suitable for Upper Primary, Early Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Amphibians: frogs, toads and salamanders. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Uses excellent close-up photos and cinematography to show a typical amphibian life-cycle and to study the differences between three kinds of amphibians - frogs, toads and salamanders. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Amphibians: frogs, toads and salamanders
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by the creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis as well as their anatomical and physiological characteristics.

results.title: Amphibians
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads, and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by these three creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis; feeding habits; hibernation; cold-bloodedness, skin and skeletal characteristics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Ampex H.S 100 video disc recorder
results.brief_description: Ampex H.S 100 video disc recorder. One of the first units used on Australian television to facilitate ‘slow mo’ replays of football action. Disc capacity approx 9 seconds. Includes one x spare 15” disc. Circa 1960s/70s

results.title: Among the wild chimpanzees
results.creator_credit: Barbara Jampel and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Presents an account of Jane Goodall’s continuing research project with wild chimpanzees in Tanzania. Details her discoveries that chimpanzees not only use but also make tools, they hunt meat and even kill one another. They also suffer from infectious human diseases. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary School students.

results.title: Among the living
results.creator_credit: Osborn Segerberg and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Raises the question of whether there is such a thing as an “optimum” world population, while looking closely at the town of Huntington on Long Island, one of the many satellite communities surrounding New York City. Presents the views on population of such noted authorities as Paul Ehrlich, Barry Commoner, Philip Hauser, Alan Guttmacher and Lincoln Day. Hosted by Don Pringle.
